issue.title: [nist-branch] Doxygen documentation of main API files
Change SHAKE implementation to be NIST-compliant
issue.body:
New issue based on comment by @steppenwolfe65 on PR #209:
SP800-185 3.2 states if S=N=0 cSHAKE output should be SHAKE. That would require adding a branch to the code that toggles the domain code from cSHAKE(0x04) to SHAKE(0x1F), all so you can test an invalid input.. does that make sense to you? I guess the point is, just because NIST does it, doesn't mean it is correct.

comment.body:
Thanks Shravan. 

I factored out your build-archive script into several individual scripts under `scripts/` so that it was easier to write the relevant tasks on both Linux and macOS (47f36a1 and ea810c8).  Also factored out the doxygen stuff into a separate commit (4c26986).  

This PR fails with Appveyor because we're not trying to build this on Windows; 55c382c8 has fixed it so any branches with the word `nist` in them won't trigger Appveyor, but for this PR we'll just ignore the Appveyor failure.

The final blocker to merging is licensing.  I can't see a license in the BIG QUAKE source or website; I've emailed the authors to find out what if any open source license it's under.

These will go in docs/algorithms.

Create a Travis check that fails if an algorithm is present in `src` but has no datasheet under `docs/algorithms`.
